definition: to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful

sentences.english: He took a mop to the floor.
They were hard at it with brooms and mops .
sentences.chinese: 他們忙着用掃帚和拖把打掃衛生。

sentences.english: Ann soaked up the water on the floor with a mop.
sentences.chinese: 小安用拖把將地板上的水吸乾。

sentences.english: She twirled the mop to get the water out of it.
sentences.chinese: 她迅速地轉動拖把，以便把水弄掉。

sentences.english: I mop the kitchen floor twice a week.
sentences.chinese: 我一星期兩次用拖把拖廚房的地板。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to a mop extracting dryer which is matched with the mop.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型涉及一種與拖把配套使用的拖把擠幹器。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to a mop extracting dryer which is matched with the mop.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型涉及一種與拖把配套使用的拖把擠幹器。

sentences.english: Buy this kind of mop, they say.
sentences.chinese: 她們說，要買某某種拖把。

sentences.english: She mopped up the water which had spilled on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她用拖把把潑在地上的水拖乾淨。

sentences.english: Also can dip in with pure cotton mop water is pigheaded work to undertake wiping to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 也可以用純棉拖把蘸水擰乾對地板進行擦拭。

sentences.english: Please sop up the water with a mop.
sentences.chinese: 用拖把把撒在地上的水拖掉。

sentences.english: He sopped up the water on the floor with mop.
sentences.chinese: 她用拖把把潑在地上的水拖乾淨。

sentences.english: And, and I gently exfoliated him with, with a mop.
sentences.chinese: 我還用拖把輕柔地給他掃背了呢。

sentences.english: Rinse with water so landscape stone should be avoided or washed stone material surface with a wet mop.
sentences.chinese: 因此景觀石應避免用水沖洗或以過溼拖把洗石材表面。
